Unit.Name: Grams Per Cubic Centimetre
Unit.Definition: Grams Per Cubic Centimetre: Grams Per Cubic Centimetre

Unit.Name: Microlitre
Unit.Definition: Microlitre: A microlitre is one millionth of a litre

Unit.Name: Micrometre
Unit.Definition: Micrometre: A micrometre is one millionth of a metre, also termed Micron.

Unit.Name: Net kilogram
Unit.Definition: Net kilogram: A unit of mass defining the total number of kilograms after deductions.

Unit.Name: Part per million
Unit.Definition: Part per million: A unit of proportion equal to 10-6 (ppm).

Unit.Name: Batch
Unit.Definition: Batch: A unit of count defining the number of batches (batch: quantity of material produced in one operation or number of animals or persons coming at once).

Unit.Name: Year
Unit.Definition: Year: Unit of time equal to 365,25 days.

Unit.Name: Troy Ounce or Apothecary Ounce
Unit.Definition: Troy ounce or apothecary ounce: The troy ounce is a unit of imperial measure. In the present day it is most commonly used to gauge the weight and therefore the price of precious metals. One troy ounce equals 480 grains or 31.1035 grams.

Unit.Name: Assortment
Unit.Definition: Assortment: A unit of count defining the number of assortments (assortment: set of items grouped in a mixed collection).

Unit.Name: Base box
Unit.Definition: Base box: A unit of area of 112 sheets of tin mil products (tin plate, tin free steel or black plate) 14 by 20 inches, or 31,360 square inches.

Unit.Name: Board Foot
Unit.Definition: Board Foot: A specialized unit of measure for the volume of rough lumber (before drying and planing with no adjustments) or planed/surfaced lumber. It is the volume of a one-foot length of a board one foot wide and one inch thick. Some countries utilize the synonym super foot or superficial foot.

Unit.Name: Barrel US
Unit.Definition: Barrel US: There are varying standards for barrel for some specific commodities, including 31 gal for beer, 40 gal for whiskey or kerosene, and 42 gal for petroleum. The general standard for liquids is 31.5 gal or half a hogshead; the general standard for dry contents is 7,056 Cubic Inches.

Unit.Name: Hundred board Foot
Unit.Definition: Hundred board foot: A unit of volume equal to one hundred board foot.

Unit.Name: British Thermal Unit
Unit.Definition: British thermal unit: The British thermal unit (BTU or Btu) is a traditional unit of energy. It is approximately the amount of energy needed to heat one pound of water one degree Fahrenheit. One Btu is equal to about 1.06 kilojoules. It is used in the power, steam generation, heating and air conditioning industries.

Unit.Name: Bushel (US)
Unit.Definition: Bushel (US): A bushel is an imperial and U.S. customary unit of dry volume, equivalent in each of these systems to 4 pecks or 8 gallons. It is used for volumes of dry commodities (not liquids), most often in agriculture

Unit.Name: Bushel (UK)
Unit.Definition: Bushel (UK): A bushel is an imperial and U.S. customary unit of dry volume, equivalent in each of these systems to 4 pecks or 8 gallons. It is used for volumes of dry commodities (not liquids), most often in agriculture

Unit.Name: Millimole
Unit.Definition: Millimole: a millimole is one thousandth of a mole.

Unit.Name: Millisecond
Unit.Definition: Millisecond: A millisecond (from milli- and second; abbreviation: ms) is a thousandth (1/1000) of a second.

Unit.Name: Centigram
Unit.Definition: Centigram: A centigram is one hundredth (1/100) of a gram

Unit.Name: Centilitre
Unit.Definition: Centilitre: A centilitre is one hundredth (1/100) of a litre

Unit.Name: Square Centimetre
Unit.Definition: Square centimetre: A square centimetre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 centimetre in length.

Unit.Name: Cubic Centimetre
Unit.Definition: Cubic centimetre: A cubic centimetre is the volume of a cube of side length one centimetre (0.01 m) equal to a millilitre.

Unit.Name: Centimetre
Unit.Definition: Centimetre: A centimetre is equal to one hundredth of a metre.

Unit.Name: Hundred pound (cwt) / hundred weight (US)
Unit.Definition: Hundred pound (cwt) / hundred weight (US): A unit of weight in the U.S. Customary System equal to 100 pounds (45.36 kilograms); also called cental.

Unit.Name: Hundred weight (UK)
Unit.Definition: Hundred weight (UK): A unit of weight in the British Imperial System equal to 112 pounds (50.80 kilograms); also called quintal.

Unit.Name: Terajoule
Unit.Definition: Terajoule: A terajoule is 10¹² joules

Unit.Name: Terawatt Hour
Unit.Definition: Terawatt hour: A terawatt hour is 109 * kilowat hour or 3.6 petajoules.

Unit.Name: Calorie - International Table (IT)
Unit.Definition: This code is being DEPRECATED. Use code E14 Kilocalorie to express food calories. Calorie - International Table (IT): A calorie is 1/100 of the amount of energy required to warm one gram of air-free water from 0 °C to 100 °C at standard atmospheric pressure; this is about 4.190 J. Its use is archaic, having been replaced by the SI unit of energy, the joule. However, in many countries it remains in common use as a unit of food energy. In the context of nutrition, and especially food labeling, the calorie is approximately equal to 4.1868 joules (J), and energy values are normally quoted in kilojoules (kJ) and kilocalories (kcal).

Unit.Name: Days
Unit.Definition: Days: A day is one three hundreds and sixty fifth (1/365) of a year

Unit.Name: Decigram
Unit.Definition: Decigram: A decigram is one tenth (1/10) of a gram.

Unit.Name: Decilitre
Unit.Definition: Decilitre: A decilitre is one tenth (1/10) of a litre.

Unit.Name: Square decimetre
Unit.Definition: Square decimetre: A square deciimetre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 deciimetre in length.

Unit.Name: Cubic decimetre
Unit.Definition: Cubic decimetre: A cubic decimetre is the volume of a cube of side length one decimetre (0.1 m)

Unit.Name: Decimetre
Unit.Definition: Decimetre: A decimetre is equal to one tenth of a metre.

Unit.Name: Dram (US)
Unit.Definition: Dram (US): The dram (archaic spelling drachm) was historically both a coin and a weight. Currently it is both a small mass in the Apothecaries' system of weights and a small unit of volume. This unit is called more correctly fluid dram or in contraction also fluidram. The term also refers to the fluid dram, a measure of capacity equal 1⁄8 of a fluid ounce, which means it is exactly equal to 3.696 691 195 312 5 mL in the United States.

Unit.Name: Dram (UK)
Unit.Definition: Dram (UK): The dram (archaic spelling drachm) was historically both a coin and a weight. Currently it is both a small mass in the Apothecaries' system of weights and a small unit of volume. This unit is called more correctly fluid dram or in contraction also fluidram. The fluid dram is defined as 1⁄8 of a fluid ounce, which means it is exactly equal to 3.551 632 812 500 0 mL in the Commonwealth and Ireland. In England dram came to mean a small draught of cordial or alcohol; hence the term dram-house for the taverns where one could purchase a dram.

Unit.Name: Dozen
Unit.Definition: Dozen: A unit of count defining the number of units in multiples of 12.

Unit.Name: Kilocalorie (international table)
Unit.Definition: Kilocalorie (international table): A unit of energy equal to 1000 calories.

Unit.Name: Dose
Unit.Definition: Dose: A unit of count defining the number of doses (dose: a definite quantity of a medicine or drug).

Unit.Name: Gross kilogram
Unit.Definition: Gross kilogram: A unit of mass defining the total number of kilograms before deductions.

Unit.Name: Use
Unit.Definition: Use: A unit of count defining the number of times an object is used.

Unit.Name: Each
Unit.Definition: Each: A unit of count defining the number of items regarded as separate units.

Unit.Name: Micromole
Unit.Definition: Micromole: One millionth (10 -6 ) of a mole.

Unit.Name: Foot
Unit.Definition: Foot: The international foot is defined to be equal to 0.3048 meters.

Unit.Name: Square Foot
Unit.Definition: Square foot: A square foot is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 foot in length.

Unit.Name: Cubic Foot
Unit.Definition: Cubic foot: A cubic foot is the volume of a cube of side length one foot (0.3048 m) .

Unit.Name: Peck
Unit.Definition: Peck: A peck is an imperial and U.S. customary unit of dry volume, equivalent in each of these systems to 2 gallons, 8 dry quarts, or 16 dry pints.

Unit.Name: Tablespoon
Unit.Definition: Tablespoon: Tablespoon. 1/2 fluid ounces, 3 teaspoons, 15 millilitres

Unit.Name: Teaspoon
Unit.Definition: Teaspoon: Teaspoon. 1/6 fluid ounces or 5 millilitres

Unit.Name: Gallon (UK)
Unit.Definition: Gallon (UK): The imperial (UK) gallon was legally defined as 4.54609 litres.

Unit.Name: Gallon (US)
Unit.Definition: Gallon (US): The U.S. liquid gallon is legally defined as 231 cubic inches, and is equal to exactly 3.785411784 litres or about 0.133680555 cubic feet.

Unit.Name: Gram Per Square Metre
Unit.Definition: "Gram per square metre: In the metric system, the density of all types of paper, paperboard, and fabric, is expressed in terms of grams per square meter (g/m²). This quantity is commonly called grammage both in English and French (ISO 536), though many English-speaking countries still refer to the "weight". The term density here is used somewhat incorrectly, as density is mass by volume. More precisely, it is a measure of the area density, areal density, or surface density."

Unit.Name: Gram:
Unit.Definition: Gram: A gram is defined as one one-thousandth of the kilogram (1×10-3 kg).

Unit.Name: Grain
Unit.Definition: Grain: A grain or troy grain is precisely 64.79891 milligrams. Exactly 7,000 grains per avoirdupois pound.

Unit.Name: Gross
Unit.Definition: Gross: A unit of count defining the number of units in multiples of 144 (12 x 12).

Unit.Name: Gigawatt Hour
Unit.Definition: Gigawatt hour: A gigaawatt hour is 109 kilowat hour or 3.6 terajoules.

Unit.Name: Piece
Unit.Definition: Piece: A unit of count defining the number of pieces (piece: a single item, article or exemplar).

Unit.Name: Hundred Count
Unit.Definition: Hundred count: A unit of count defining the number of units counted in multiples of 100.

Unit.Name: Half Dozen
Unit.Definition: Half dozen: A unit of count defining the number of units in multiplt of six (6).

Unit.Name: Hectogram
Unit.Definition: Hectogram: A hectogram is one hundred (100) grams

Unit.Name: Hectolitre
Unit.Definition: Hectolitre: A hectolitre is one hundred (100) litres.

Unit.Name: Hour
Unit.Definition: Hour: An hour is a unit of measurement of time of the duration of 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds. It is 1/24 of a median Earth day.

Unit.Name: Inches
Unit.Definition: Inches: An international inch is defined to be equal to 25.4 millimeters.

Unit.Name: Square Inch
Unit.Definition: Square inch: A square inch is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 inch in length.

Unit.Name: Cubic Inch
Unit.Definition: Cubic inch: A cubic inch is the volume of a cube of side length one inch (0.254 m).

Unit.Name: Joule
Unit.Definition: Joule: A joule is the energy exerted by a force of one newton acting to move an object through a distance of one metre.

Unit.Name: Kilolitre
Unit.Definition: Kilolitre: A kilolitre is one thousand (1000) litres.

Unit.Name: Kilogram
Unit.Definition: Kilogram: A unit of mass equal to one thousand grams.

Unit.Name: Kilojoule
Unit.Definition: Kilojoule: A kilojoule is 1000 joules

Unit.Name: Kilometre
Unit.Definition: Kilometre: A kilometre is one thousand (1000) metres

Unit.Name: Kit
Unit.Definition: Kit: A unit of count defining the number of kits (kit: tub, barrel or pail).

Unit.Name: Kilowatt Hour
Unit.Definition: Kilowatt hour: A kilowatt hour is a unit of energy equal to 3.6 megajoules. It is also a common commercial unit of electric energy representing the amount of energy delivered at a rate of 1,000 watts over a period of one hour.

Unit.Name: Kilowatt
Unit.Definition: Kilowatt: A kilowatt is one thousand (1000) watts

Unit.Name: Pound
Unit.Definition: Pound: The international avoirdupois pound of exactly 0.45359237 kilogram.

Unit.Name: Linear Foot
Unit.Definition: Linear foot: A unit of count defining the number of feet (12-inch) in length of a uniform width object.

Unit.Name: Link
Unit.Definition: Link: A unit of distance equal to 0.01 chain.

Unit.Name: Linear Metre
Unit.Definition: Linear metre: A unit of count defining the number of metres in length of a uniform width object.

Unit.Name: Layer
Unit.Definition: Layer: A unit of count defining the number of layers.

Unit.Name: Ton (UK) or long ton (US)
Unit.Definition: Ton (UK) or long ton (US): Ton (UK) = 1016 Kg or 2240 Lb.

Unit.Name: Litre
Unit.Definition: Litre: A litre is defined as a special name for a cubic decimetre (1 L = 1 dm3 = 1000 cm3).

Unit.Name: Megawatt
Unit.Definition: Megawatt: A unit of power defining the rate of energy transferred or consumed when a current of 1000 amperes flows due to a potential of 1000 volts at unity power factor.

Unit.Name: Microgram
Unit.Definition: Microgram: A microgram is one millionth of a gram (0.000001)

Unit.Name: Milligram
Unit.Definition: Milligram: A milligram is one thousandth of a gram (0.001)

Unit.Name: Square mile
Unit.Definition: Square mile: A square mile is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 mile in length.

Unit.Name: Minute (unit of time)
Unit.Definition: Minute (unit of time): A minute is a unit of time equal to 1/60th of an hour or 60 seconds

Unit.Name: Millilitre
Unit.Definition: Millilitre: A millilitre is one thousandth of a litre (0.001)

Unit.Name: Square millimetre
Unit.Definition: Square millimetre: A square millimetre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 millimetre in length.

Unit.Name: Cubic millimetre
Unit.Definition: Cubic millimetre: A cubic millimetre is the volume of a cube of side length one milliimetre (0.001 m)

Unit.Name: Millimetre
Unit.Definition: Millimetre: A millimetre is one thousandth of a metre (0.001)

Unit.Name: Month: Unit of time equal to 1/12 of a year of 365,25 days
Unit.Definition: Month: Unit of time equal to 1/12 of a year of 365,25 days

Unit.Name: Square Metre
Unit.Definition: Square metre: A square metre is an area of a square whose sides are exactly 1 metre in length.

Unit.Name: Cubic metre
Unit.Definition: Cubic metre: A cubic metre is the volume of a cube of side length one metre.

Unit.Name: Metre
Unit.Definition: Metre: The metre is the basic unit of length in the International System of Units (SI).

Unit.Name: Megawatt Hour
Unit.Definition: Megawatt hour (1000 kW.h): A unit of energy defining the total amount of bulk energy transferred or consumed.

Unit.Name: Load
Unit.Definition: Load: A unit of volume defining the number of loads (load: a quantity of items carried or processed at one time).

Unit.Name: Ounces Per Square Yard
Unit.Definition: Ounces per square yard: The weight of one square yard of the material expressed in ounces. Commonly used to express the density or weight of all types of paper, paperboard, and fabric, e.g. 20 OZ or 20 weight denim has an area density of 20 oz/yd2. The term density here is used somewhat incorrectly, as density is mass by volume. More precisely, it is a measure of the area density, areal density, or surface density.

Unit.Name: Ounce
Unit.Definition: Ounce: A unit of mass with several definitions, the most commonly used of which are equal to approximately 30 grams

Unit.Name: Fluid ounce (US)
Unit.Definition: Fluid ounce (US): A fluid ounce (US) is equal to one sixteenth (1/16) of a US pint or 29.5735295625 millilitres.

Unit.Name: Fluid ounce (UK)
Unit.Definition: Fluid ounce (UK): A fluid ounce (UK) is equal to one thirtieth (1/30) of a UK pint or 28.4130625 millilitres.

Unit.Name: Percent:
Unit.Definition: Percent: A unit of proportion equal to 0.01.

Unit.Name: Pad
Unit.Definition: Pad: A unit of count defining the number of pads (pad: block of paper sheets fastened together at one end).

Unit.Name: Pair
Unit.Definition: Pair: A unit of count defining the number of pairs (pair: item described by two's).

Unit.Name: Dry Pint (US)
Unit.Definition: Dry Pint (US): The United States dry pint is equal one eighth of a US dry gallon or one half US dry quarts. It is used in the United States but is not as common as the liquid pint.

Unit.Name: Pint (UK)
Unit.Definition: Pint (UK): A pint (UK) is equal to 1/8 Gallon (UK); used primarily as a measure for beer and cider when sold by the glass.

Unit.Name: Liquid pint (US)
Unit.Definition: Liquid pint (US): The US liquid pint is equal one eighth of a United States liquid gallon.

Unit.Name: Page - Hardcopy
Unit.Definition: Page - hardcopy: A unit of count defining the number of hardcopy pages (hardcopy page: a page rendered as printed or written output on paper, film, or other permanent medium).

Unit.Name: Quart (US dry)
Unit.Definition: Quart (US dry): A US dry quart is equal to 1/32 of a US bushel, exactly 1.101220942715 litres.

Unit.Name: Liquid quart (US)
Unit.Definition: Liquid quart (US): A US liquid quart exactly equals 57.75 cubic inches, which is exactly equal to 0.946352946 litres.

Unit.Name: Second (unit of time)
Unit.Definition: Second (unit of time): A second is a unit of time equal to 1/60th of a minute.

Unit.Name: Set
Unit.Definition: Set: A unit of count defining the number of sets (set: a number of objects grouped together).

Unit.Name: Mile (statute mile)
Unit.Definition: Mile (statute mile): A statute mile of 5,280 feet (exactly 1,609.344 meters).

Unit.Name: Serving
Unit.Definition: Serving: The recommended portion of food to be eaten

Unit.Name: Ton (US) or short ton (UK)
Unit.Definition: Ton (US) or short ton (UK): Ton (US) = 2000 Lb. or 907 Kg.

Unit.Name: Shipment
Unit.Definition: Shipment: A unit of count defining the number of shipments (shipment: an amount of goods shipped or transported).

Unit.Name: Tonne
Unit.Definition: Tonne: Metric ton = 1000 Kg

Unit.Name: Tablet
Unit.Definition: Tablet: A unit of count defining the number of tablets (tablet: a small flat or compressed solid object).

Unit.Name: Week
Unit.Definition: Week: A week is a time unit equal to seven days.

Unit.Name: Watt hour
Unit.Definition: Watt hour: The watt-hour is a unit of energy equivalent to one watt of power expended for one hour of time; it is equal to 3.6 kilojoules. The watt-hour is rarely used to express energy in any form other than electrical.

Unit.Name: Watt
Unit.Definition: Watt: A watt is a derived unit of power; one watt is equivalent to 1 joule (J) of energy per second.

Unit.Name: Nanogram
Unit.Definition: Nanogram: A nano gram is 10-9 gram or a billionth of a gram.

Unit.Name: Square Yard
Unit.Definition: Square Yard: A square yard is the area of a square with sides of one yard (three feet, thirty-six inches, 0.9144 metres) in length

Unit.Name: Yard
Unit.Definition: Yard: A yard is It is equal to 3 feet or 36 inches or 0.9144 meter.

Unit.Name: Mutually Defined
Unit.Definition: Mutually Defined: A unit of measure as agreed in common between two or more parties.
